ygData.subject: Re: possible big cheat for EQ....
ygData.msgSnippet: ... aye, the best you could do would be... stop/start the rain... change night / day.... and stuff like that. but no permanent changes in your character at
ygData.messageBody:
James J. Coolman wrote:

> From: "James J. Coolman" <coolman@...>
>
> As a programmer, I know the hazards associated with third party
> Programs fudging your data. The way EQ is set up, any
> modifications you make are reflected in YOUR computer's memory,
> and maybe even your display, but NOT on veran'ts server. You
> FEED commands to Verant, the actions are resolved on the server,
> and the RESULTS are sent back to you. You may modify the commands
> sent, or the results on your screen, and it won't change what
> happens to your character on verants servers at all. It is a great
> way to preclude tampering. You may change your screen to show
> 50000pp, but try to buy something.... The next screen update will
> show your real totals... Your character and all interaction with it
> are done BY Verant on their own servers. You have NO real contact with
> anything that must be modified for any kind of cheat to work.

aye, the best you could do would be... stop/start the rain... change night / day....
and stuff like that. but no permanent changes in your character at all. Maybe, but
just maybe you could get rid of root, blind and spells like that ... just intercept the
server feed using some program to tunnel it and remove/add commands from the
feed , the server would think you are rooted but since your EQ client didnt recieve
the command to root you it would let you move freely.

Its kinda easy to do this kind of stuff... it isnt a MAJOR hack since it wont change
exp, stats, items and stuff like that but it would give you BIG advantage in PvP.

Its kida easy to do that if you know how to play around with sockets and have control
of a DNS server (since the update server name and all the other servers names are hard
coded and/or sent through TCP/UDP stream, you need a way to make your EQ client belive
he is connecting in the server while its actually connecting in your local machine)

Anyway, its easy to avoid this kind of cheat using any kind of encrypted stream (which would
increase lag) or any kind of security keys to let the server know if its really talking with your
EQ client or with any other third party software tunneling the stream.

But does anyone ever tryed that and know how good Verant's security really is ? I dont have
the time and I really dont feel like giving all the effort to cheat EQ.

>
>
> I welcome any questions or comments....
